critique: The document outlines exceptions to the competitive service within the civil service, focusing on positions of a confidential or policy-determining character. It establishes schedules (A, B, C) for these exceptions and clarifies the status and removal processes for incumbents. The order delegates authority to the Civil Service Commission to classify positions and make decisions regarding exceptions. There is no explicit discussion of immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion.
